intro: Androcalva beeronensis, commonly known as the beeronensis shield-leaf, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Androcalva beeronensis is known for its unique leaf structure, which provides protection against herbivores and intense sunlight.
